items.question: How do credits work for motion generation?
items.answer: Our system is credit-based. Typically, generating a standard **5-second motion costs 10 credits**. Longer or higher-quality generations may cost more. Your monthly credit allowance resets at the start of each billing cycle.

items.question: What is the difference between the Free and Paid plans?
items.answer: The **Free plan** is for testing and personal use; assets are public and cannot be used commercially. **Paid plans (Creator & Pro)** unlock the **Commercial License**, **Private Mode** (hidden from gallery), and significantly faster generation speeds.

items.question: Can I use the FBX files in my commercial game?
items.answer: Yes! If you are subscribed to the **Creator (Basic)** or **Pro Studio** plan, you own the assets you generate. You can freely use them in commercial games, VFX projects, or advertisements without paying royalties.

items.question: Does unused credit roll over to the next month?
items.answer: Currently, monthly credits do not roll over. They reset on your billing date. However, if you purchase separate 'Top-Up Packs', those credits never expire.

items.question: What software are the files compatible with?
items.answer: We export standard `.fbx` animation files. They are compatible with industry-standard tools like **Blender, Unity, Unreal Engine 5, Maya, and Cinema 4D**. The skeletons are optimized for easy retargeting.

items.question: Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
items.answer: Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time from your dashboard. You will retain access to your plan features and remaining credits until the end of your current billing period.

items.question: Do you offer refunds?
items.answer: We generally do not offer refunds for partial months or used credits due to the high GPU costs involved in generation. However, if you encounter technical issues, please contact support.

items.question: What is 'Private Mode'?
items.answer: By default, all generations are displayed in the community gallery to inspire others. **Private Mode** (available on paid plans) ensures your generations are only visible to you, protecting your unique game mechanics or story ideas.
